data: CARD Cardiac Catheterization (Angiogram) and PCI (Angioplasty) Pre Procedure
If patient is unable to give informed consent, please arrange for a family member/legal guardian to accompany patient to the department. Consent must be obtained by a physician
If eGFR is LESS than 45 mL/min consider using various clinical characteristics to evaluate prospectively the potential risk of developing post PCI contrast-induced nephropathy
Pregnancy testing for women of childbearing age
18g or 20g on the left arm preferred
8 hours prior to PCI and Angiogram, may have clear fluids until 3 hours prior to procedure
Stop enteral tube feeding 8 hours prior to PCI and Angiogram in a non-intubated non-ventilated patient
Encourage PO fluid intake to prevent dehydration
For intubated ventilated patients, stop and aspirate the NG-tube /OG-tube immediately prior to transfer to cardiac catheterization Lab
order rate: 25 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 75 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
Refer to Contrast - Induced Nephropathy (CIN) protocol if eGFR LESS than 45 mL/min and NOT on dialysis
order rate: 1 mL/kg/h, IV, order duration: 4 hour, drug form: bag
order rate: 3 mL/kg/h, IV, order duration: 1 hour, drug form: bag
Clinical event: Pre Cardiac Catheterization, Medication(s) to be held: diuretic, Instructions: Hold on day of cardiac catheterization
Clinical event: Pre Cardiac Catheterization, Medication(s) to be held: metFORMIN, Instructions: Hold 1 day prior to cardiac catheterization
Clinical event: Pre Cardiac Catheterization, Medication(s) to be held: NSAID, Instructions: Hold 1 day prior to cardiac catheterization if eGFR is LESS than 45 mL/min
For patients with allergies to contrast dye ONLY: select diphenhydrAMINE AND hydrocortisone OR diphenhydrAMINE AND predniSONE
25 mg, IV, pre-procedure, drug form: inj
100 mg, IV, pre-procedure, drug form: inj
50 mg, PO, as directed, order duration: 2 doses or times, drug form: tab
If patient is on heparin IV infusion discontinue heparin on arrival to cardiac catheterization lab
Clinical event: Pre Cardiac Catheterization, Medication(s) to be held: LMWH (enoxaparin or dalteparin), Instructions: Hold morning of cardiac catheterization
Please ensure one dose of ASA is ordered
325 mg, PO, once, drug form: tab, first dose: STAT
81 mg, PO, once, drug form: tab-EC
600 mg, PO, once, drug form: tab, first dose: STAT
300 mg, PO, once, drug form: tab, first dose: STAT
75 mg, PO, once, drug form: tab, first dose: STAT
180 mg, PO, once, drug form: tab, first dose: STAT
90 mg, PO, once, drug form: tab, first dose: STAT

AVOID nitroglycerin if any of the following are present  - SBP LESS than 90 mmHg or if more than 30 mmHg drop from baseline  - Right ventricular infarction  - Recent use of phosphodiesterase inhibitors, within 24 hours for sildenafil (VIAGRA) and vardenafil (LEVITRA), within 48 hours for tadalafil (CIALIS)
If/when patient already on nitroglycerin infusion, then continue at the current rate
1 spray, sublingual, q5min, PRN other (see comment), drug form: spray
dose range: 2 to 5 mg, IV, q5min, PRN other (see comment)
25 mcg, IV, q15min, PRN pain, drug form: inj
1 mg, sublingual, q4h, PRN anxiety, drug form: tab-sublingual
dose range: 25 to 50 mg, PO, q4h, PRN nausea or vomiting, drug form: tab
dose range: 25 to 50 mg, IV, q4h, PRN nausea or vomiting, drug form: inj
0.5 mg, IV, as directed, PRN other (see comment), order duration: 2 doses or times, drug form: inj
If no blood work done prior to admission in the last 90 days, order the following:
For OUTPATIENTS, select Sodium and Potassium Panel (Electrolytes Panel Outpatient (Na, K))
Electrolytes Panel (Na, K, Cl, CO2, Anion Gap)
If patient on warfarin and INR not done in previous 24 hours
For Cardiac biopsies select the Pathology Surgical Request order
If not done in the previous 7 days
If/when recurrent ischemic symptoms or arrhythmias present, then RN to place order for Electrocardiogram 12 Lead STAT
Urgent, Schedule as: Inpatient Scheduling Location: SPH Cath Lab, Primary Indication: Cardiomyopathy-Hypertrophic
Provide supplemental oxygen to patients who have SpO2 less than 92%, breathlessness, signs of heart failure, or shock
Titrate O2 to keep SpO2 88 - 92 %, Nasal Cannula, up to 6 L/min, for known CO2 retainers
Reason for Consult: Patient requires full face mask
Send patients own dentures, hearing aid and glasses to the Catheterization Lab pre procedure
